document.docAuthor: Barreto-Triana, Nancy, Ferreira, Paulo Sergio F., Osorio-Mejía, Pablo Andrés & Fiuza Ferreira, Luciano S.
document.masterDocTitle: Plant bugs (Hemiptera: Miridae) associated with pastures in Colombia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Plant bugs (Hemiptera: Miridae) associated with pastures in Colombia

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis: General coloration brown to fusco-testaceous; head with Y-shaped black spot on frons; cuneus mostly fuscous; endosoma with C-shaped distal sclerite with thick, variable sized spines and large tongue-shaped spinose region basal.

Distribution: United States ,
Mexico
,
Guatemala
, El Salvador , Honduras , Nicaragua , Cuba , Jamaica , Costa Rica ,
Panama
, Colombia , Venezuela , Ecuador , Peru , Brazil ,
Paraguay
, Haiti , Dominican Republic ,
Trinidad and Tobago
and Argentina ( Carvalho & Fontes 1981 ; Morales et al. 2016 ).

Plant associations: Fabaceae :
Phaseolus vulgaris
. Poaceae :
Andropogon gayanus
,
Avena sativa
;
Brachiaria decumbens
;
Digitaria decumbens
;
Digitaria sanguinalis
;
Eriochloa polystachya
,
Oryza sativa
;
Panicum maximum
,
Panicum muticum
;
Panicum numidianum
;
Triticum vulgare
;
Setaria setosa
;
Sorghum vulgare
;
Zea mays (
Morales et al. 2016
)
,
Cenchrus clandestinus
synonimus
Pennisetum clandestinum
(new record).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 5–8.
Collaria oleosa
: (5) habitus (dorsal view). 6–8: male genitalia: (6) aedeagus; (7) left paramere; (8) right paramere (redrawn from Carvalho & Fontes, 1981).
